summary: 06/22/1993: The IRA exploded a 300 lb. bomb in an Austin Metro van near the Mourne Country Hotel causing minor damage and injuries.
weapdetail: The 300lb. bomb was planted in a stolen van. Officials believed it was made of fertilizer.
propcomment: The front wall of the hotel fell down and some minor damage was caused to surrounding homes.
addnotes: Reports stated that the IRA warned officials beforehand, but it did not specify how. The IRA usually phoned in such warnings.
scite1: “Bomb injuries two after terror blitz warning,” Press Association, June 22, 1993.
scite2: Owen Bowcott, “IRA van bomb damages country hotel and 70 homes,” The Guardian (London), June 23, 1993.
